lrt is bad again - Xiaohongshu search -.raw:
Lone Warrior
focus on
Kelana Jaya LRT malfunction
The Kelana Jaya Line experienced another malfunction
during rush hour; leaving many commuters stranded at
stations and disrupted. This is not the first time the line
has malfunctioned at a critical time;
the relevant
authorities have been slow to resolve the issue; Which
is disappointing: Each time the system malfunctions;
the Ministry Of Transport's response is identical: social
media notifications;
apologies;and suggestions
to passengers to use alternative modes of transport。
However;, this mechanical approach fails to truly
alleviate the inconvenience to the public. Public
transport disruptions are not just about time
severely disrupt work, study, and daily life. As one
of the busiest light rail lines; the Kelana Jaya Line
carries millions Of passengers daily; including
commuters; students; and the elderly. When the system
malfunctions; the impact is far-reaching: commuters
are late or forced to take time Off work; students miss
classes and exams; and the elderly are unable to access
medical care on time; affecting their treatment
alternative transport seems like a solution, but it's not
feasible for many passengers. Ride-hailing services are
overhelmed
peak hours; with
soaring;
making them unaffordable for many; even if people are
to pay;
may not beable to hail a ride。
Transport Minister Anthony Loke visited Singapore to
learn from its efficient MRT operation. Singapore's
success lies in its strict implementation of
"regular
maintenance and proactive upkeep.
Does Malaysia's
LRT system have a similar mechanism? Are there
preventative maintenance and rapid response plans? Is
something。。
